meanings.definition: Piled up in a large quantity.
meanings.sent1: The heaped pile of toys in the corner was ready to be sorted.
meanings.sent2: The heaped plate of cookies was tempting everyone at the party.
meanings.sent3: The heaped laundry basket seemed to grow taller every time I looked away.
meanings.sent4: Her heaped enthusiasm for the project was contagious to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The heaped mountain of books in the library was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: Covered or filled with a large amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The heaped bowl of ice cream was a delicious treat on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The heaped plate of spaghetti was too much for one person to finish.
meanings.sent3: The heaped closet was a treasure trove of forgotten items.
meanings.sent4: Her heaped plate of salad was a colorful masterpiece of vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The heaped basket of fresh fruits was a feast for the eyes.

meanings.definition: To gather or accumulate in a large mass.
meanings.sent1: She heaped the leaves into a big pile for jumping.
meanings.sent2: The workers heaped the sand into a mound for construction.
meanings.sent3: He heaped compliments on his friend, making them blush.
meanings.sent4: The chef heaped spices into the pot for a flavorful stew.
meanings.sent5: They heaped rocks along the path to create a natural barrier.
